messages.title: A message from Daniel Zeichner
messages.content: The day I became the Member of Parliament for Cambridge was the proudest day of my life. I’d been the candidate here in Cambridge twice but at different times it seemed that I would never see my name on the green benches of the House of Commons. I became your MP because, just like me, you believe in Labour’s principles, strong values and local issues. I stick to my principles and I will sell out when necessary.

messages.title: Send a message to Tim Farron's Lib Dems
messages.content: We reject your values. Cambridge chooses hope. WARNING: Just TWO years ago, Tim Farron's Lib Dem candidate for Cambridge was voting with the Tories, day in, day out. He betrayed you 782 times. Has he apologised? No. Have the Lib Dems learned? No.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Vote for a local representative who will support fair pay and manageable workloads for local teachers.
Support getting Cambridge moving with excellent public transport and cycling provision.
Properly fund Cambridge's under-threat NHS and end the Social Care Crisis.
Scrap tuition fees, end our broken education system and create new opportunities.
Win well-paid secure jobs and decent affordable homes for the future.
Protect our city’s older people against plans to cut pensions.
Tackle inequality and protect Cambridge's jobs of the future in technology and science.
A real Living Wage of £10 an hour, and making sure everyone – especially young people who don't currently have them – has increased social mobility.
Continue to take action to improve our local mental health services, which is still in huge need of change led by the Lib Dem minister.

issues.brexitEurope: Tim Farron: 'I’m a bit of a Eurosceptic'
issues.economy: A real Living Wage of £10 an hour.
issues.environment: Decarbonise Britain's energy supply, restore our planet.

issues.labourEmployment: Win well-paid secure jobs and decent affordable homes for the future. Tackle inequality and protect Cambridge's jobs of the future in technology and science.
issues.transport: Revitalize the railways and get Cambridge moving with excellent public transport and cycling provision.
issues.socialWelfare: Protect our city’s older people against plans to cut pensions.
